name: United States
notes: H1B lottery system makes it unpredictable. Very competitive but highest salaries in tech. Long green card backlogs for some countries.

visa_types.name: H-1B Specialty Occupation Visa
visa_types.description: Primary work visa for skilled professionals. Subject to annual lottery.
visa_types.path_to_pr: Employer sponsors Green Card (PERM → I-140 → I-485)
visa_types.spouse_work_rights: H-4 EAD if I-140 approved (uncertain policy)
tips: Apply through multiple employers if possible

visa_types.name: L-1 Intracompany Transfer
visa_types.description: Transfer within same company from foreign office to US.
requirements: US entity must be related to foreign employer
visa_types.path_to_pr: Can sponsor Green Card, L-1A has EB-1C path
tips: L-1A can lead to EB-1C Green Card (no labor certification)

visa_types.name: O-1 Extraordinary Ability
visa_types.description: For individuals with extraordinary ability or achievement.
requirements: Evidence of extraordinary ability (awards, publications, etc.)
Coming to work in area of expertise
visa_types.path_to_pr: Can self-petition for EB-1A Green Card
tips: Tech can qualify (GitHub stars, conferences, patents)

visa_types.name: F-1 Student Visa
visa_types.description: Student visa with OPT work authorization post-graduation.
visa_types.path_to_pr: OPT → H-1B lottery → Green Card (or try O-1)
visa_types.work_hours_limit: 20 hours during school, full-time OPT after
tips: Multiple H-1B lottery attempts during OPT
